page.title: 17Mrs Taylor's day i
page.content: { Mrs Taylor}starts her work at about { 7 a.m.}She first prepares breakfast which is at{7.30 a.m.}Her husband is a {gamekeeper}as is her nineteen year old son. Her daughter, who is fifteen, goes to a school in{Shaftesbury. Her son starts at{six,}but her husband and daughter are out by{eight.}She has made packed lunches the night before. After breakfast{Mrs Taylor}washes and stacks the dishes and pans, then, if it is winter, for three days a week she exercises hunters belonging to a family called the{Coopers.}When she gets back, she might do{flower arrang- {ments}at the{King John,}or start her washing in a twin-tub. In winter the clothes have to be dried in racks in the Aga-heated front room. After a snack lunch, she often chats to people who drop in. {Continued on page 18
